tool_description:
LOL Champion and Summoner Stats.  To consume a service, perform a GET request on api.elophant.com/v2/<region>/<resource>. Remember, you must include your developer key for authentication (<resource>?key=).

Each developer is currently rate-limited to 1,000 calls every 15 minutes. We highly discourage making an unreasonable amount of requests (100 calls/second).

All calls now return the proper content-type for Json. Also, the number of requests remaining has been added to the header. This value is updated immediately.

The regions we current support include: NA, EUW, EUNE, and BR.
name: Elophant League of Legends
title: Elophant League of Legends

api_list.name: GET find_team
api_list.description: Returns a brief overview of a team, including gameType dependent tiers and divisions, the current roster, and basic match history statistics.  Use this method only if and when teamId is not known or cannot be found another way.  When requesting a team tag or name with a space, use "%20" to represent the space.  On that note, always URL encode the team tag or name to avoid false error messages.

required_parameters.name: tagorname
required_parameters.description: Specifies the tag or name of the team to look up. Example Value: tsm or Team Solo Mid

api_list.name: GET mastery_pages
api_list.description: Returns an array with each mastery book page and subsequent talent point entries for a specific summoner.  Mastery pages are very complex objects. We recommend that you play around with different talent entries to obtain their "talentId".  The most important values when reconstructing a page are "rank" and "talentId".

required_parameters.name: summonerid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the summonerId of the summoner to look up. Example Value: 5908

api_list.name: GET rune_pages
api_list.description: Returns an array with each rune page and subsequent runes for a specific summoner.  Rune pages are very complex objects. We recommend that you play around with different runes to obtain their "runeId".

required_parameters.name: summonerid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the summonerId of the summoner to look up. Example Value: 5908

api_list.name: GET in_progress_game_info
api_list.description: Returns the player information for both teams, bans (if draft or ranked), and observer information.  If the summoner is not found, an error will be returned.  If the summoner is found, but is not in game, an error will be returned.

required_parameters.name: summonername
required_parameters.description: Specifies the name of the summoner to look up. Example Values: Dyrus or dyrus

api_list.name: GET summoner
api_list.description: Returns a summoner's accountId, summonerId, account level, and profile icon id. This method has one of the smallest return sizes for the amount of value it possesses.  When requesting a summoner with a space in their name, use "%20" to represent the space.  On that note, please URL encode all summoner names before making a request.  Use this method to find out a summoner's accountId and summonerId when only the name is known. From there, requests for mastery pages or rune pages are easy.

required_parameters.name: summonername
required_parameters.description: Specifies the name of the summoner to look up. Example Values: HotshotGG or hotshotgg

api_list.name: GET summoner_team_info
api_list.description: Returns all team info regarding the specified summoner, including team overviews and all of the teams the summoner has created. Use this method to obtain teamIds for use in other team-related methods.  This method also returns a brief match history for each team the summoner is on.  The value "date" returns a binary encoded DateTime object. Be sure to account for that in your code.  Team names with special characters contain special encoding.

required_parameters.name: summonerid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the summonerId of the summoner to look up. Example Value: 5908

api_list.name: GET team_ranked_stats
api_list.description: Returns each team member's statistics for the specified team. This call provides very similar results to summoner ranked_stats.

required_parameters.name: teamid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the teamId of the team to look up. Example Value: TEAM-e4936d7b-b80e-4367-a76c-5ccf7388c995

api_list.name: GET leagues
api_list.description: Returns the current Leagues for the requested summonerId, including all players within each League.

required_parameters.name: summonerid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the summonerId of the summoner to look up. Example Value: 5908

api_list.name: GET team_end_of_game_stats
api_list.description: Returns very detailed statistics about the specified match.  Note: This request is only for teams, like TSM or CLG, not individual summoners.

required_parameters.name: teamid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the teamId of the team to look up. Example Value: TEAM-e4936d7b-b80e-4367-a76c-5ccf7388c995

required_parameters.name: gameid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the gameId to look up. Example Value: 357749707

api_list.name: GET items
api_list.description: Returns every item's id and name in Json.  We do not recommend calling this method too often because it does count as an API call. Try to cache it and only use this method for updates.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com/na/items"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com/{region}/items"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GET team
api_list.description: Returns a brief overview of a team, including gameType dependent Elos, the current roster, and basic match history statistics.  Use this method in favor of find_team when the teamId is known because this method is faster.

required_parameters.name: teamid
required_parameters.description: Specifies the teamId of the team to look up. Example Value: TEAM-e4936d7b-b80e-4367-a76c-5ccf7388c995

api_list.name: GET champions
api_list.description: Returns every champion's id and name in Json.  We do not recommend calling this method too often because it does count as an API call. Try to cache it and only use this method for updates.  A champion with an id of "0" does not exist. We use it to deal with exceptions.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-elophant-league-of-legends.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
